thread.title: Super Rugby: All Blacks and Chiefs great Sione Lauaki found dead
thread.title_full: Super Rugby: All Blacks and Chiefs great Sione Lauaki found dead

author: news.com.au
title: Super Rugby: All Blacks and Chiefs great Sione Lauaki found dead
text:
FORMER All Blacks and Chiefs loose forward Sione Lauaki has died aged 35. 
Lauaki was diagnosed with kidney and heart problems in 2012, picked up by biological assessments while he was playing for Bayonne in France.
A massive but athletic player, Tonga-born Lauaki played 17 Tests for the All Blacks between 2005 and 2008.
Former All Blacks and chiefs forward Sione Lauaki has passed away. Source: Getty Images 
He also played for Auckland and Waikato in the national provincial championships and the Chiefs in Super Rugby.
Former All Blacks and Chiefs teammates have acknowledged Lauaki‚Äôs death and expressed their condolences via Twitter.
Blues coach and former All Blacks captain Tana Umaga led the chorus on Sunday morning.
‚ÄúAnother brother gone! Much love and condolences to his family,‚Äù Umaga tweeted.
Damn. It's a sad day today, rest easy dox @SioneLauaki üíî
‚Äî Sonny Bill Williams (@SonnyBWilliams) February 11, 2017 Another brother gone! Much love and Condolences to his family! #RILWax ! üòî https://t.co/GRXFTKK4XC 
‚Äî Tana Umaga (@tanaumaga) February 11, 2017 Sione lauaki.. played with but not against (thank goodness ) gone to soon wax.. rest in peace bruv @SioneLauaki üôÅ
‚Äî Israel Akuhata Dagg (@izzy_dagg) February 11, 2017 ‚ÄúDamn. It‚Äôs a sad day today, rest easy dox,‚Äù Sonny Bill Williams said via Twitter, while another All Blacks teammate, Israel Dagg, also tweeted his condolences.
‚ÄúPlayed with but not against (thank goodness ) gone too soon Wax.. rest in peace bruv.‚Äù
Sione Lauaki in action for the All Blacks against Portugal during the 2007 Rugby World Cup. Source: Getty Images 
The Chiefs rugby franchise and the All Blacks also expressed condolences via Twitter.
‚ÄúWe are shocked and deeply saddened to learn of the passing of Sione Lauaki this morning,‚Äù the Chiefs said.
‚ÄúThe thoughts of everyone are with the family of Sione Lauaki... Gone too soon,‚Äù NZ Rugby said.
Wallabies star Israel Folau also offered his condolences via Twitter.
‚ÄúSad to hear the passing of @SioneLauaki. Love and prayers to the family,‚Äù Folau tweeted.
Originally published as Former All Black Sione Lauaki dies at 35
